snippet.title: Husband pleads for help finding Alzheimer's-afflicted wife, 72, last seen in Fitzroy on Tuesday
snippet.content:
The husband of a missing 72-year-old Alzheimer's sufferer has made a desperate plea for the public to help find her. Barbara Norris was last seen on Smith Street in Fitzroy about 2pm on Tuesday afternoon.Photo: 3AW She was wearing a teal jumper, blue jeans, purple runners and was carrying a black handbag when she went missing. Mrs Norris is described as 165cm tall with a slim build and shoulder-length blonde hair.Photo: Supplied Her husband Les, who was with Mrs Norris when she was last seen, called radio station 3AW on Wednesday morning to ask for public assistance. Police have concerns for the woman's welfare due to her age and medical condition. She is known to frequent the Carlton, Richmond and Fitzroy areas. Investigators have released an image of Mrs Norris in the hope that someone can provide information about her current whereabouts.
You will now receive updates from
AM & PM Update Newsletter
AM & PM Update Newsletter
Get the latest news and updates emailed straight to your inbox.
Anyone who sights Mrs Norris or has information on her whereabouts is urged to contact Fitzroy Police Station on 9934 6400.
